Description: Small tusk (hippopotamus incisor); pierced around the top for attachment; incised detail with remnants of black pigment in incisions. One of a pair with EA30729.
Curator's comments: For discussion of objects of this type see S. Hendrickx and M. Eyckerman (2011), Tusks and tags: Between the hippotamus and the Naqada plant. In: R. Friedman and P. Fiske(eds), Egypt at its Origins 3. OLA 205. Leuven: 497-571. (TYPE A.3.a)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
